case_title: FEDERATION OF PAKISTAN through Secretary, Narcotics Control Division, Ministry of Interior and Narcotics Control, Government of Pakistan, Islamabad and another vs NOOR HUSSAIN PATHAN
appellant: FEDERATION OF PAKISTAN through Secretary, Narcotics Control Division, Ministry of Interior and Narcotics Control, Government of Pakistan, Islamabad
Chairman, Pakistan Narcotics Control Board, Rawalpindi

accussed_details.name: Noor Hussain Pathan
accussed_details.designation: Field Investigating Officer, Pakistan Narcotics Control Board
allegation: Aided and abetted in the escape of a smuggler in his custody

complaint_summary: The respondent, Noor Hussain Pathan, was dismissed from service on charges of aiding and abetting the escape of a smuggler in his custody.
investigation_summary: Three inquiries were conducted regarding the charges. The first inquiry was deemed improperly conducted. The second and third inquiries found the respondent not guilty. The authorized officer disagreed with the findings of the third inquiry, citing reasons in the show-cause notice.

judgment_summary.order: Respondent Noor Hussain Pathan, Field Investigating Officer of Pakistan Narcotics Control Board, was dismissed from service on the charge of aiding and abetting in the escape of a smuggler in his custody. The Federal Service Tribunal reinstated him with back benefits. The Federation of Pakistan filed this petition seeking leave to appeal against the Tribunal's decision.
key_points: Multiple inquiries were held regarding the charge, with varying findings.
Federal Service Tribunal was influenced by the findings of the inquiries.
Contention raised that the Tribunal did not fully appraise the entire record, including statements and FIR filed by the respondent.
Leave granted to examine the sustainability of the Tribunal's decision in law.

punishment: Reinstatement with back benefits (Federal Service Tribunal decision)
legal_arguments: Federal Service Tribunal did not review the entire record, including statements of P.C. Zakir Hussain and the respondent.
Authorized officer provided cogent reasons to disagree with the third inquiry report.

witness_statement.P.C. Zakir Hussain: Statement referenced but details not provided in the judgment.

key_issues: Whether the Federal Service Tribunal's decision was legally sustainable.
Whether the Tribunal properly appraised the entire record.

legal_terms.Show-cause notice: A legal notice requiring an individual to explain or justify their actions.

words_and_phrases.Leave granted: Permission given by the court to proceed with an appeal.

summary_vector_notes: The case involves the dismissal of a government officer for alleged misconduct and subsequent reinstatement by the Federal Service Tribunal. The Supreme Court granted leave to appeal to assess the Tribunal's decision and its appraisal of evidence.
